definition: to be determined
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: Millions of money to anger, revenge Japanese mountain.
sentences.chinese: 钱百万怒不可遏，决意下山报复日军。

sentences.english: Experience of Zhao shake day arrived the might of landmine, be determined learns to make thunder technology secretly.
sentences.chinese: 赵震天见识到了地雷的威力，决意偷学造雷技术。

sentences.english: He resigned in 1927 and decided to become a writer.
sentences.chinese: 1927年，奥威尔辞去职务，决意成为一名作家。

sentences.english: But she fell in love with this life is determined that a cup of tea.
sentences.chinese: 但她这辈子是决意爱上了那一杯奶茶。

sentences.english: However, there is no assurance that the price will move in a straight line.
sentences.chinese: 然而，没有保证价格决意搬进一条直线。

sentences.english: She is absolutely set on publishing as a career.
I have decided to learn shorthand.
For which cause, forbearing no longer, we thought it good to remain at Athens alone.
sentences.chinese: 为此，我们不能再等待，就决意独自留在雅典。

sentences.english: What agony was this! And the man seemed resolved to protract it.
sentences.chinese: 那是什么病痛呀？这人似乎决意吞吞吐吐。

sentences.english: Having opted to leave, Bergkamp's decision to join Arsenal was made quickly.
sentences.chinese: 决意要走，于是他很快决定加盟阿森纳。

sentences.english: And the man seemed resolved to protract it.
sentences.chinese: 这人似乎决意吞吞吐吐。

sentences.english: Many people make and break the same resolution year after year.
sentences.chinese: 许多人年复一年制定和打破相同的决意。

sentences.english: The bus was late, and the driver was bent on reaching the school on time.
sentences.chinese: 汽车开迟了，驾驶员决意准时开到学校。

sentences.english: The second day will go to Paris pear son clothing, determined to find the U.
sentences.chinese: 第二天将要去巴黎的梨衣子，决意去找美加。

sentences.english: And Judas purposed to destroy them: and he called together all the people, to besiege them.
sentences.chinese: 犹大决意铲除他们，便召集全体百姓，向他们围攻。

sentences.english: But if you decide to ③make the leap, tread carefully.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果你决意“来一段”的话，一定得步步小心。

definition: to be determined to/to insist on
firmly/resolutely/without hesitation
determined/unshakable
to hold on firmly/to cling (to a belief)/stubbornly
to pledge one's life
already
discouraged/downhearted
to block/to prevent by force
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
to put one's all into the fight
focus/with complete devotion/stubbornly
lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat/to burn one's boats
change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to stake all on one throw
prevail/convince
